position: {{marker.position}}

Creates a Google Maps Marker instance. Requires either a position parameter or lat / lng parameters. There is no limit to the number of marker directives that can be added, but consider using "points" or "geopoints" for larger datasets.

HTML 

<div map ng-transclude class="google-map" center="map.center" options="map.options"> 
	<marker position="marker.position" round="marker.round" options="marker.options"></marker>
</div>

JavaScript 

$scope.marker = {
	position: [39, -121],
	round: 4,
	options: {
		draggable: true
	}
}

Parameters

Param Type Details
